intro: Elaeosticta paniculata, commonly known as the panicled elaeosticta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences, giving it a fluffy appearance. Its leaves are typically alternate, lanceolate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Elaeosticta paniculata is often found in open woodland and savanna habitats, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
